summary: Lady Cobra
title: Lady Cobra
body:
The Red Viper meets his match: Lady Cobra.

the cobra and the viper

“So you are who they call Lady Cobra,” Oberyn said after he walked through a doorway of hanging beads. He had entered a spacious room with a variety of couches scattered around, all dyed the warm…

Read more…

summary: ‘I’ve been an NHS patient for 70 years’
title: ‘I’ve been an NHS patient for 70 years’
body:
Jean Jones was only a toddler when the NHS came kicking and screaming into life on 5 July 1948.

But she immediately became one of its first patients as she had what turned to be a rare cancer called histiocytosis.

It had caused permanent damage to her kidneys, lungs and pituitary gland and meant she was constantly in and out of her local hospital, The Christie in Greater Manchester, in the early years of the health service’s life.

She has remained under the care of the hospital ever since – and even now has regular check-ups and still has to take hormone drugs.

  • Is the NHS a champion or an also-ran?
  • The history of the NHS in charts
  • Forget 70 – what will the NHS look like at 100?

She says she owes the health service her life – and her treatment even inspired her to dedicate her career to the NHS, because she went on to become a nurse.

“Before the NHS came along you had to pay for everything. I’ve had a lot of treatment over the years. I don’t know if I would have been able to afford it.

“I take medication every day, but I’ve been lucky because it’s obviously worked for me. I have every reason to be grateful to the NHS.”

Her memories of her early treatment are quite hazy – she was only 20 months old in 1948.

But she says all the nurses were “very nice” and remembers her mother bringing in her ration book to give sugar coupons to the women who made the tea “so they could buy sweets for the children”.

After finishing school she worked as a hairdresser for three years, but then retrained as a nurse, eventually specialising in surgical nursing.

She has been telling her story as the NHS celebrates its 70th birthday.

When the NHS was created it was the first time anywhere in the world that completely free healthcare was made available on the basis of citizenship rather than the payment of fees or insurance.

How the nation is celebrating

Celebration events are taking place across the UK, including services at Westminster Abbey and York Minister.

The NHS logo will also be projected on to famous landmarks including the Eden Project in Cornwall, the Houses of Parliament and the London Eye.

There will also be thousands of NHS-themed public tea parties taking place.

In a reception at Downing Street on Wednesday night for health staff, Prime Minister Theresa May praised the longevity of the NHS.

“In my line of work there are not many ideas from 70 years ago that are unquestionably supported today, but that is undoubtedly the case with our National Health Service,” she said.

“In a world that has changed almost beyond recognition, the vision at the heart of the NHS – of a tax-funded service that is available to all, free at the point of use with care based on clinical need and not the ability to pay – still retains near-universal acceptance.”

A TV star’s story

Meanwhile, Game of Thrones TV star Emilia Clarke has also been paying her own tribute to the NHS.

She has accepted the position of an ambassador for the Royal College of Nursing – something she said she was inspired to do following the excellent care her dying father received two years ago.

She watched on as staff comforted him and then her and is now full of praise for the “awe-inspiring skill” and “emotional intelligence” they showed.

“I know my dad received the best care and medical support.

“To see family members suffer and then to see nurses selflessly care for that person means so much.

“After a panic at hearing bells and buzzers I didn’t understand, the hug that came my way and the words that accompanied it both reassured and comforted me.

“The NHS is there for everyone – and we will all need it at some point.”

Is it a happy birthday?

Thursday is a time for celebration for the health service. But it also comes at a crucial point.

The service has been struggling to hit its targets – it has been missing the key targets for cancer, A&E and hospital operations recently.

Can’t find your health trust? Browse the full list

Rather search by typing? Back to search

If you can’t see the NHS Tracker, click or tap here.

There are also significant staff vacancy rates – one in 12 posts are not filled in England.

Last week, an independent report produced for the BBC by leading academics warned the NHS was lagging behind other countries when it came to treating common, life-threatening illnesses, such as cancer and heart attacks.

But the government maintains it is responding to the challenge.

Ahead of the 70th anniversary, the government announced the NHS budget in England would increase by £20bn a year by 2023, with extra funding also made available for the rest of the UK.

Related Topics

  • NHS at 70

Read more: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-44621050

The post ‘I’ve been an NHS patient for 70 years’ appeared first on Viral TV News.

blog.name: faramir-boromir
blog.title: rebellions are built on hope
blog.description: I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory. I love only that which they defend.

summary: I was jealous of Robb my whole life. The way my father looked at him, I wanted that. He was better than me at everything....
caption: I was jealous of Robb my whole life. The way my father looked at him, I wanted that. He was better than me at everything. Fighting, and hunting, and riding, and girls. Gods, the girls loved him. I wanted to hate him, but I never could.

reblog.comment: I was jealous of Robb my whole life. The way my father looked at him, I wanted that. He was better than me at everything. Fighting, and hunting, and riding, and girls. Gods, the girls loved him. I wanted to hate him, but I never could.

trail.content_raw: I was jealous of Robb my whole life. The way my father looked at him, I wanted that. He was better than me at everything. Fighting, and hunting, and riding, and girls. Gods, the girls loved him. I wanted to hate him, but I never could.
trail.content: I was jealous of Robb my whole life. The way my father looked at him, I wanted that. He was better than me at everything. Fighting, and hunting, and riding, and girls. Gods, the girls loved him. I wanted to hate him, but I never could.

blog.name: licensingcorner
blog.title: Licensing Corner
blog.description: India’s first and only Magazine on Brand Licensing & Merchandising!

summary: To all Lannister, Targaryen and Stark fans out there! HBO has partnered with Diageo to release eight special single malt...
body:
To all Lannister, Targaryen and Stark fans out there! HBO has partnered with Diageo to release eight special single malt whiskeys each representing a House from the fictional land of Westeros.

The Game of Thrones whisky collection will include eight editions from various distilleries owned by Diageo. Seven of these will represent the ‘Great Houses of the Seven Kingdoms’ whereas the last one will be dedicated to the Night’s Watch. The collection comprises of:

  • Talisker Select Reserve representing ‘House Greyjoy’
  • Royal Lochnagar 12 Years representing ‘House Baratheon’
  • Lagavulin 9-Year-Old representing ‘House Lannister’
  • Cardhu Gold Reserve representing ‘House Targaryen’
  • Dalwhinnie Winter’s Frost representing ‘House Stark’
  • Singleton of Glendullan Select representing ‘House Tully’
  • Clynelish Reserve representing ‘House Tyrell’
  • Oban Bay Reserve dedicated to ‘The Night’s Watch’

Check out the collection here:

This slideshow requires JavaScript.

The deal was brokered by Beanstalk Licensing. The labels have been approved by the Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau. However, no details on the pricing have been revealed yet.

The collection is expected to be released in late autumn or early winter just before the release of the final season of ‘Game of Thrones’ series.

Besides, Diageo has also released Game of Thrones Johnnie Walker whiskey. Called White Walker, Johnnie Walker recently posted a 20-second video on social media announcing the imminent launch of the Scotch, featuring a dramatic soundtrack and the tagline “Scotch is coming to the realm this Fall – White Walker by Johnnie Walker.”

This will be the first spirit, delivered through a collaboration between HBO and Diageo. White Walker by Johnnie Walker will also be released around the same time.

HBO, Diageo unveil ‘Game of Thrones’ single malt scotch whisky collection To all Lannister, Targaryen and Stark fans out there! HBO has partnered with Diageo to release eight special single malt whiskeys each representing a House from the fictional land of Westeros.

HBO, Diageo unveil ‘Game of Thrones’ single malt scotch whisky collection To all Lannister, Targaryen and Stark fans out there! HBO has partnered with Diageo to release eight special single malt whiskeys each representing a House from the fictional land of Westeros.
trail.content:
To all Lannister, Targaryen and Stark fans out there! HBO has partnered with Diageo to release eight special single malt whiskeys each representing a House from the fictional land of Westeros.

The Game of Thrones whisky collection will include eight editions from various distilleries owned by Diageo. Seven of these will represent the ‘Great Houses of the Seven Kingdoms’ whereas the last one will be dedicated to the Night’s Watch. The collection comprises of:

  • Talisker Select Reserve representing ‘House Greyjoy’
  • Royal Lochnagar 12 Years representing ‘House Baratheon’
  • Lagavulin 9-Year-Old representing ‘House Lannister’
  • Cardhu Gold Reserve representing ‘House Targaryen’
  • Dalwhinnie Winter’s Frost representing ‘House Stark’
  • Singleton of Glendullan Select representing ‘House Tully’
  • Clynelish Reserve representing ‘House Tyrell’
  • Oban Bay Reserve dedicated to ‘The Night’s Watch’

Check out the collection here:

This slideshow requires JavaScript.

The deal was brokered by Beanstalk Licensing. The labels have been approved by the Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau. However, no details on the pricing have been revealed yet.

The collection is expected to be released in late autumn or early winter just before the release of the final season of ‘Game of Thrones’ series.

Besides, Diageo has also released Game of Thrones Johnnie Walker whiskey. Called White Walker, Johnnie Walker recently posted a 20-second video on social media announcing the imminent launch of the Scotch, featuring a dramatic soundtrack and the tagline “Scotch is coming to the realm this Fall – White Walker by Johnnie Walker.”

This will be the first spirit, delivered through a collaboration between HBO and Diageo. White Walker by Johnnie Walker will also be released around the same time.

HBO, Diageo unveil ‘Game of Thrones’ single malt scotch whisky collection To all Lannister, Targaryen and Stark fans out there! HBO has partnered with Diageo to release eight special single malt whiskeys each representing a House from the fictional land of Westeros.

summary:
Let's talk dreams because I just woke up from one.
All the living headed to the wall to fight the white walkers. Everyone is...
body:
Let’s talk dreams because I just woke up from one.

All the living headed to the wall to fight the white walkers. Everyone is somber. It’s the day before the final battle. They decide to gather and dance as a final celebration of life.

Two people in the circle. Laughter can be heard. It lasts only a moment. The Night King is in the crowd. He wasn’t even noticed. He commands two people together with a whisper. Spell-like. Tells one to kill the other. It’s an effective way to gain more men, to destroy the enemy.

And then he’s on Jon. While all the living watch. Fuck turning them one by one, killing Jon means killing hope. So he leans in. And the only sound is Sansa’s gutteral screaming.

The Night King places his lips on Jon’s. You expect to see Jon’s eyes turn blue. But they don’t. The Night King is the only transformation as he becomes human again, lost and confused like a newborn baby scrambling from the gathering.

Jon doesn’t move. Sansa’s wailing is the only sound as she throws herself over his body. Jon. Doesn’t. Move.

But in another realm, ruled by death, Jon is there. Screaming. Confused. Inching away from Sansa’s touch as if it scalds. A wolf lost from reality. Trapped in a body of stone. Dead. Screaming until his throat bleeds red.

All the living headed to the wall to fight the white walkers. Everyone is somber. It’s the day before the final battle. They decide to gather and dance as a final celebration of life.

Two people in the circle. Laughter can be heard. It lasts only a moment. The Night King is in the crowd. He wasn’t even noticed. He commands two people together with a whisper. Spell-like. Tells one to kill the other. It’s an effective way to gain more men, to destroy the enemy.

And then he’s on Jon. While all the living watch. Fuck turning them one by one, killing Jon means killing hope. So he leans in. And the only sound is Sansa’s gutteral screaming.

The Night King places his lips on Jon’s. You expect to see Jon’s eyes turn blue. But they don’t. The Night King is the only transformation as he becomes human again, lost and confused like a newborn baby scrambling from the gathering.

Jon doesn’t move. Sansa’s wailing is the only sound as she throws herself over his body. Jon. Doesn’t. Move.

summary: So, I just had a thought. Consider this, what if- the last season of Game of Thrones has a weird twist at the end, something...
body: So, I just had a thought. Consider this, what if- the last season of Game of Thrones has a weird twist at the end, something along the lines of Hang the DJ from Black Mirror… Can you imagine- Westeros being Fictional™ , everything that happened, every damn thing, was not real…

summary: uh, well, you’re in the minority lmao if your whole beloved family was slaughtered and you were the last to live you’d realize...
body:
uh, well, you’re in the minority lmao if your whole beloved family was slaughtered and you were the last to live you’d realize how stupid you sound right now

jon had a strong will to live FOR HIS FAMILY. he was fighting to get out from under them because the battle was still not lost yet. which meant he had to keep trying. he only told her to not bring him back if the battle was lost, i.e. he died. the battle was not over until jon was killed.

that’s not an assumption on my part, that’s basic comprehension skills. everyone jon loved or believed in betrayed him or was murdered. everything rode on him saving the day. if he failed, rickon was as good as dead, bran was as good as dead, sansa was as good as dead, and arya was as good as dead. hence why he said to hell with life and not to bring him back IF HE FALLS.

jon’s will to live has nothing to do with sansa specifically, you sound delusional saying that shit. it has to do with literally everything jon’s been through. losing the rest of his four siblings would just be the final nail in the coffin. if you don’t get it, then it’s cuz you don’t get jon snow.

jesus, i really think a majority of jonsas dont know what its like to have a family

@hereyesblueasice

summary: the problem with season 8 is that I want six hours for just jon and dany alone and six hours for all the rest but what we are...
body:
the problem with season 8 is that I want six hours for just jon and dany alone and six hours for all the rest but what we are getting is six hours for everything.

it’s not enough ? At all? I want to see more on my babiessss.
